38804878.review:
If there was one word to describe The Darkside Detective, it would be CHARMING! From the John Carpenter-esque music to the retro pixelated atmosphere to the pun-wielding duo of McQueen and Dooley, this game is nothing short of lovable. Throw in some dad-level nerd jokes that would melt even the coldest heart and puzzles that are not overly complicated but always satisfying and you have the recipe that, for me anyway, makes for a great little indie gaming experience.

The cases are rather short (even the longest will run you only about an hour in playtime) and I definitely wouldn't recommend this if you're looking for some really hardcore puzzling, but what I like about the structure of the game is that the puzzles are always varied and enjoyable. Sometimes you're just hunting for clues, but other times you'll be asked to play small mini-games (like tile puzzles, etc.) which keeps it interesting! Though the puzzles are fairly light, you will still run into small roadblocks here and there that may have you hunting for a guide after clicking every inch of the screen, but for the most part, I was rarely frustrated and never bored and it was the perfect balance!

That being said, where the charm really shines is in the writing. This game is rife with nerdy pop-culture references (everything from Twin Peaks to X-Files to Lovecraft to games like Mass Effect), but the story itself isn’t necessarily focused on horror if anyone was worried about that. It does amp the level of enjoyment if you get some of the references, but I wouldn’t call this game scary by any means because it’s all embedded in a THICK layer of adorable humor that makes it all charming and fun regardless. This game will definitely make you laugh if you have any appreciation for puns (and even punnier references) and I highly, highly suggest you click Dooley everywhere you go because his dialogue with McQueen is pretty priceless. Those two have great back and forth (I can't be the only one who ships it) and Dooley is the most lovable kind of idiot you'll be glad to call sidekick through all your paranormal sleuthing adventures.

Can’t say enough good things about this perfect little game and am really hoping to see more soon! 10/10, would recommend!!

Things I like about it after playing it through.
-------------------------------------------------
1. The banter between the two main characters is very funny at times and made me fall in love with them instantly, the humour gives the game a lot of charm.
2. The levels though sometimes at first appear small can be quite complex and interesting, a little like the tardis, this is goes for the puzzles too.
3. Lots and lots of gaming / pop culture references.

After playing this game, the fourth wall is in shreds. The main high point of the game is clearly the humour, to the extent that I don't think you're getting the full experience if you don't click on everything and read every line of text. I did thoroughly enjoy it, although you should probably know what you're getting into before you start playing. If you like funny point and click adventure games as well as meta humour, you'll probably like this. At time of me writing this, I believe one of the achievements to be bugged but I firmly believe that they will work to fix it as they have with other problems that have cropped up. I thought the final DLC case was pretty fun but there was some logic in it that didn't make too much sense to me. Maybe it just stuck out to me more because it's brand new and so was hard to find help for online. The game wasn't too long but it's episodic nature makes it seem like you can just put it down and then come back later and pick it back up. The cases aren't really related to each other so you can leave time between playing them if you so wish. That said, I did feel more motivated to play through than another episodic game that I bought this year which I shall not name. 
I'm writing this review just because, honestly, I don't think this game will receive as much exposure as it should and if I can do something small to help that, then here it is. (Not that I think anyone on my friends list even plays adventure games...)
A funny game, I recommend highly if you like text based point and click games that don't take themselves too seriously.

38434995.review:
I read about Darkside Detective about a year ago and was eager to play a new point-and-click adventure full of light-hearted references to the X-Files and Twin Peaks.  Unfortunately, in-jokes and puns are all this game has going for it.  Darkside Detective isn't very good.

I enjoyed the graphics, and some of the jokes made me chuckle (the characters of McQueen and Dooley are goofy, but they make for a decent "buddy-cop" couple), but the core gameplay is too simple, and unsatisfying.  All of the puzzles have obvious solutions, and are of the "add this-to-that" variety - most of the puzzles in any one room can be solved by using a key item from the room just next door.  I suppose the gameplay's shortcomings could be overlooked if the story was compelling, but it's just a formulaic pastiche of tropes from supernatural television shows, horror movies and other, better adveture games.  There's nothing original here.  What's worse is that for a supernatural game involving a detective, the episodic stories in Darkside Detective don't have a mystery that ties them altogether at the end.  Each little story happens - and then there's a final story, and that's the end.  There's nothing nefarious, nor amuzing behind the Spooky Door - just some shlock about a zombie mobster.  It's Scooby-Doo stuff, but without the charm.


I can't recommend anyone download this game; in terms of narrative and in terms of gameplay, this one is a letdown.  It's too bad, I really liked the premise, but the designers don't seem to have grasped that adventure games are more than solving obtuse puzzles and pipe-games.

36535539.review:
Well. The writing's good, the pixel art is solid, the puzzles lack that Roberta Williams logic that makes you tear out your hair and the music is excellent.

But you shouldn't buy this game.

Unless you are functionally retarded, there's less than two hours of gameplay in The Darkside Detective. Which, at the price, is just too little. You can find good games at roughly the same price that'll give you twelve hours, or more, of gameplay. 

Just click on every interactible object in every room, so you'll hoover up all of the inventory items you can find, and then it's usually pretty obvious what you need to do. The only times I was, very briefly, stumped, was when I didn't realize an object was interactible or when a solution just seemed so obvious that I skipped it rather than trying it first.

I genuinely feel a bit bad about not recommending this game, because it obviously has a lot of soul, but it's just not good value for your money, but I hope that the creators return with bigger projects that contain more content and gameplay, because I think they've got the solid writing needed to back up an adventure game.

36522897.review:
Nice presentation but a little basic. I'm a big fan of point-and-click adventures and story/comedy focused games in general so I was really excited to find a new, well-reviewed adventure game to play. Unfortunately Darkside Detective doesn't really have enough depth or cleverness to it to really deliver. 

This game has likable characters and a fun setup but the stories and jokes don't really feel like they had much effort put into them. Everything feels like it was written as a first draft and they didn't bother to improve on it. A lot of the comedy just consists of direct references to pop culture (Ghostbusters, Gremlins, Dr Who etc.), which just made me cringe most of the time. On top of that, the gameplay is way too simple to really keep your attention. It's not just that the puzzles aren't difficult or elaborate enough, it's that you only have one task to do at a time and you can pretty much always predict how you're going to have to solve it. There aren't really any moments where you have to think laterally you just encounter a problem, immediately deduce how to solve it and then wonder around looking for whatever object you need.

Creating a silly, breezy game around this dark subject matter is a great idea, it's just a shame they didn't build on that premise with some compelling stories and puzzles. If you're a fan of point-and-click games I'd recommend steering clear as you'll likely just be bored and disappointed.

34987221.review:
[h1]The Darkside Detective: a short review focused on its humor[/h1]

I have just finished the game (skipping the first chapter because I already played it in the demo) and I had to give this quick suggestion to everybody: if you love dry/deadpan humor, you will probably enjoy this game [b]a lot[/b].

The big pixels used by the graphic artist don't make it possible to draw the main facial details, with the unexpected positive result that every character seems to keep a serious face, enforcing the impression that the jokes are delivered in a dry way!

All the characters are funny but probably Dooley and the Bloodwolf kids provide the best jokes. You'll love Dooley: the fact that he's so dumb doesn't make the character less adorable and in the last chapter of the game his dumbness will also save him from a serious supernatural danger.

I've never ever laughed so hard for any recent adventure game, the humor of this game is top-notch and you should buy it if this kind of comedy is your cup of tea.

Finally, in this period I didn't want to embark on a long and complex adventure game and the chapter-based structure of "The Darkside Detective" made it a more casual and lightweight experience that I have appreciate a lot.

I recommend the game wholeheartedly.

34853435.review:
*very minor spoilers*

A really cute spooky point-and-click adventure game. Very punny if that's your thing (it's mine, and I loved every one of them), if not this game probably isn't for you (or most games of this genre). It was kinda weird to me that it didn't go all out in either serious/dark or silly plot like most point-and-click adventures go (especially a paranormal one) but once I realized that I got into it more for what it was. I really enjoyed the two leads Detective McQueen & Officer Dooley. They have great chemistry and play off each other well enough to keep the cases fun and hold stakes at the end. The subplot about the darkside unit and it's origins and relationship with the city is very interesting and would be great to springboard off of if this game does well enough to do a sequel!

The game itself is kinda short given that each of the 6 cases isn't that long, but given the price and quality I'd say what I got was pretty fair. While short, each case (by my gauge) where mostly just challenging enough. I *tried* not to cheat and most of the logic is pretty sound, but still at least once a case on average I had to look up what to do, but that just might be my shortcoming, it all made sense. The music was pretty nice, as well as the art. 

*I DID initially play with my sister, but she quit by the 2nd case because there is a lot of flickering lights used for atmosphere (especially in the 2nd case) and it's migraine inducing if you'r sensitive to it (even with my brightness all the way down, it gave me a headache and I tried to avoid those rooms). 
*The only other sensory complaint was fly noises in two screens in the 5th case. They are REALLY irritating (to me personally, most people probably not so much) and I feel like they didn't really add to the camp vibe despite how (disturbingly) real they sounded. Neither of those things took my enjoyment away from playing the game per say (aside from not being able to include my sister), but I feel like they should still be taken note of.

BUT those grievences took up a very small slice of the game, which I could tell was made with a lot of heart, and puns. Lots of puns.

Fellow truthies, the government would lead you to believe that [b]The Darkside Detective[/b] is a short (playthrough would take from 4 to 5 hours) police comedy point'n'click light adventure game [strike]running on a top secret engine powered by stolen nightmares[/strike].
National security services all over the world would claim that the game includes six loosely connected cases of paranormal activity investigation totally NOT based on real events. 
Media outlets will tell you the writing in the game is fairly funny (even if a tad uneven, with the later cases being significantly more amusing than the first couple). Unsurprising, considering the game was written by P. G. Wodehouse and Douglas Adams. But was reanimating and keeping them as a duo of imprisoned zombie slave writers ethical? Highly questionable!
At first glance, The Darkside Detective's puzzles are designed to be straightforward, but the exact same set of puzzles is required to break the seals on the sarcophagus of Senusret III and release the alien traveler entombed in it. Coincidence?
The game also features a fantastic soundtrack by Ben Prunty, composer of FTL and the author of the national hymn of the  Antarctic Elder Being Republic.

There's a couple of friendly-looking men in black at the door, probably salesmen. I will continue this revelatory review right after dismissing them and whatever it is they're selling.

-Darkside Detective Review-  

Darkside Detective ist ein point and click spiel in Pixel Grafik und ist auch gleichzeitig das erste spiel von dem Entwicklerstudio Spooky Doorway.  Das Spiel überrascht mit seinen fesselnden Soundtracks und seiner packenden Story und seinem guten Humor.

Man spielt Detective Francis McQueen und man wird stehts von dem tollpatschigen Kollegen Officer Dooley begleitet der nicht grade der hellste ist. Beide sind dafür zuständig Fälle mit paranormalen aktivitäten zu untersuchen das Geschehen spielt in Twin Lakes einer amerikanischen Stadt wie jede andere .


 -PROS UND CONTRAS-

Das spiel bietet 6 abwechslungsreiche Level (fälle) darunter eine u-bahn ,Villa und 4 weitere. Zwischendurch muss man auch verschiedene Minispiele meistern um weiter zu kommen  und es werden bestimmte Aktionen mit verschiedenen Sounds hinterlegt. Das Ziel ist es alle fälle zu lösen. Die Fälle bestehen daraus das man Gegenstände finden muss und damit Rätsel mit logischem denken zu lösen. Das spiel ist gesamt ein solides gutes Point and click spiel mit guter Story schöner Pixel Grafik und mit einem Humor für jedermann leider ist das Spiel etwas kurz und nicht sonderlich herausfordernd und hat leider nicht viele Soundeffekte und für unerfahrene Spieler im point and click Genre gibt es leider kein Tutorial nur eine kurze Einblendung mit der Steuerung und den spiel Mechaniken. Leider kann man nicht mit allem interagieren dafür hat das spiel aber abwechslungsreiche Level und durch die einfache Grafik läuft das spiel auch auf jedem System flüssig. Das spiel ist recht klein nur ca 150mb das ist besonders gut für Leute die  nicht so eine gute Internetleitung haben somit kann jeder das spiel in kürzester zeit herunterladen.    


                                 -ENTWICKLERSTUDIO-

Spooky hallway könnte ihn Zukunft auf jeden fall anderen Firmen im Bereich Point and Click und Abenteuer Konkurrenz machen. Das Entwickler Studio Spooky Doorway, das aus 5 verschiedenen Leuten besteht darunter Paul Conway der seit 10 Jahren in der Videospiel Branche arbeitet und schon bei über 100 spielen mitgearbeitet hat. Dann haben wir noch Dave Mccabe, Christopher Colston er ist ein Spiel Designer und Entwickler aus Schottland noch mit dabei ist Tracey Mccabe sie ist Software Entwicklerin und die Frau von Dave Mccabe als letzes haben wir Ben Prunty der für die Musik und die Sounds zuständig ist, wurde 2016 gegründet und veröffentlichte ihr erstes Spiel am 27 Juli 2017.     

                  -FAZIT-
Darkside detective ist alles in allem ein sehr gelungenes spiel mit guter Atmosphäre und Einzigartiger Story und abwechslungsreichen Level und  verschiedenen rätseln. Es ist sehr empfehlenswert für Fans des Point and Clicks Genre und es ist auf jeden fall seine  12 Euro wert.

34198332.review:
One of the biggest Steam purchase disappointments I ever had. Not that watching the trailer didn't provide its share of warning signs. But I didn't listen to my gut feeling. First of all, the engine turned out to be to be much more crude and basic than I expected, and the puzzles (at least in the first 2 cases) provided zero challenge value. The art design, music and the graphics are, however, excellent, and probably the main reason people choose to ignore the game's staggering flaws.

What could offset the pedestrian gameplay is the story and characters, of course, but the game falls terribly flat here, providing a pre-teen level of storytelling and characterisation, not to mention the insufferable forcing of continuously uninspired humour, whose painful delivery is placed completely above any attempt to provide a compelling story and characters. It's like an extreme case of Sword & Sworcery, where a brilliantly looking game with a wonderfully atmosphere and art design is in such a jarring opposition to the quality of its story and writing, it's tragic to witness it.

I don't have a habit of writing reviews here, but this is by far the most deceiving ratio of approval in comparison with the product quality I ever experience on this platform, so I felt a need to compile a personal disapproval. Hopefully my review will make some people think twice before buying this without trying the demo.

It is definitely worrying to see this amount of praise and approval, Steam curators included (!), for such a dubious product. I expected for the Indie game audience to have more sense.

I'm on the verge for asking a refund, but I will probably keep the game as a reminder of my folly, to consider a purchase more critically...next time I see pretty graphics.

https://niveloculto.com/analisis-the-darkside-detective/

Mantener la mesura es algo realmente complicado dentro del videojuego. Creo que la frase que más veces he repetido cuando alguien me ha pedido mi opinión sobre un proyecto que estaban comenzando ha sido “vale, pero no te flipes”. Centrar el tiro en cualquier tipo de proyecto creativo es siempre de las cosas más complicadas, y el elemento interactivo del videojuego lo hace todavía más difícil. Quizás por eso, o porque me veo completamente reflejado en esos títulos que introducen elementos que no terminan de llevar a ningún lado (MI VIDA), valoro tanto cuando un título es completamente consciente de sus puntos fuertes y trata que el resto de elementos se encarguen de resaltarlos. The Darkside Detective es quizás uno de los mayores ejercicios en este sentido que me he encontrado este año. Su posición es la de un francotirador invisible que únicamente levanta la mirilla cuando se dispone a disparar, aunque aquí no serán balas, sino un montón de buenos diálogos y situaciones que lo elevan como un entretenimiento de lo más recomendable.

The Darkside Detective es un point & click canónico. Nuestro personaje no se mueve y apenas hay animaciones más allá de las ambientales, sin embargo, se siente completamente vivo. Esto se debe en parte a una estupenda puesta en escena a base de pixel gordote y colores vivos a los que los acompaña una estupenda banda sonora de Ben Prunty (FTL), pero sobre todo a un especial cuidado de personajes y diálogos.

En esto de los point & clicks y las Aventuras Graficas hay escuelas y están quienes anteponen los puzles a los personajes y viceversa. Yo me declaro de los segundos, y quiero pensar que si muchos recuerdan con cariño al primer Monkey Island (pato + polea) es que hay más por ahí como yo. Aquí tenemos el primer problema para el hispanohablante: The Darkside Detective no está traducido a nuestro idioma.

Es cierto que no requiere un nivel de inglés muy alto y que debido a la sencillez de la mayoría de sus puzles creo que podría terminarse sin necesidad de entender ni una sola palabra, pero el punto fuerte del juego son la mezcla de situaciones, diálogos y personajes, por lo que si se elimina el idioma de la ecuación tenemos un grave problema. Si esto no supone un problema para ustedes prepárense para conocer a Doodley, oficialmente el mejor personaje de un juego de este estilo en años.

Doodley es nuestro Watson, aunque se trata de un Watson perezoso y descreído para el que cualquier elemento sobrenatural únicamente significa que llegará un par de horas tarde a casa. Su presencia es ese “vale, pero no te flipes” en la cabeza de los desarrolladores que se encarga de relativizar cualquier situación, destacando cualquier elemento incongruente que se encuentre en ella, aunque este vaya dirigido hacia el propio juego. El equipo de Spooky Doorway no tiene problemas en destacar incoherencias, referencias o incluso el sobreuso de escenarios reciclados dentro de la propia trama de cada uno de los capítulos, y ahí estará Doodley para poner los pies en el suelo. Él está ahí para sacarse sueldo y a otra cosa. Un perfecto funcionario al que le da igual que se trate de fantasmas o un familiar del Monstruo del Lago Ness. Hace su trabajo y se va. Algo que es casi una provocación en estos tiempos de persona=empresa.

El título se encuentra dividido en seis capítulos independientes. Los dos primeros son accesibles desde el principio mientras que el resto se irán desbloqueando según vayamos resolviéndolos. No es necesario que juguemos a los dos primeros en orden, pero sí conveniente, pues hay personajes que intervienen en varios capítulos y se hará referencia a ellos. La duración de cada uno de estos episodios varía, pero podríamos poner una media de treinta minutos descontando el último, que es algo más largo y contiene más localizaciones que el resto. Al principio se podría pensar que cada uno de los episodios corresponde a un homenaje velado a un clásico de la cultura pop como podrían ser Los Gremlins o Viernes 13, pero una vez más hay que reconocer al estudio irlandés su buena medida en este asunto. Hay guiños, pero se entremezclan entre sí hasta formar una nueva historia que los descontextualiza del referente original, lo que ante la saturación de ochenterismo que llevamos en los últimos años es de agradecer.

Lo que tenemos una vez terminado The Darkside Detective es uno de esos títulos que se disfrutan como si fuera un atracón de capítulos de una serie emitida a través de alguna plataforma digital. Habrá quien eche de menos una mayor dificultad en los puzles o algún capítulo más, pero no es mi caso. Tanto enfoque como duración me parecen perfectos, y el hecho de que apenas se hayan alejado del concepto original (el título partió de una jam) me parece mucho más meritorio que si se hubieran liado a incluir elementos superficiales. The Darkside Detective funciona gracias a su simplicidad y unos diálogos que para sí querrían la mayoría de point & click. No necesito más.

34107957.review:
I loved the game.

* Puzzles are neither too hard, nor too easy. Everything you do is logical.
* Each chapter present a non-adventure puzzle, like connecting pipe pieces to maintain a water flow.

There are some great ideas (ex. case files instead of one full story), lots of easter eggs and fourth-wall-breakings. A solid 3.5-4 hours of play time even for point 'n' click veterans. At the end of the road we can't but crave for more!

34060633.review:

34059864.review:

34055261.review:
Despite beeing part of a genre where games like this are a dime a dozen, Darkside Detective actually stands out from the crowd. A surprisingly amount of variation and well-written - and sometimes deep - humor makes this game really fun to play. Granted, it does not take long to finish the game, but they are not hiding that fact, nor attempting to artificially inflate the time it takes to finish the game.

Despite this, the full prize of $10  might be a bit to steep for this game. I enjoyed it, and thought it nearly worth the prize. If this games comes on sale: BUY IT!!

34051671.review:
Pros:
-Clever plotlines and witty jokes. Good use of refrences that are accessable to most players but don't feel pandering

-Fun, casual point and click gameplay. You rarely have more than 3 or 4 objects at any given point and most rooms serve a only one or two purposes.

-Uses an X-Files/Twin Peaks type setting which is rarely seen in video games.

-Both main characters are really likable. Your partner (Officer Dooley) rarely actually helps you, but always has a joke or non sequitur to say

-Looks and sounds really good, regardless of if you're into pixel art or not.  

-Most objects are easily defined, and the game rewards you for clicking everything in the room with a joke anway. I only ran into one object that I really coulden't find during my playthrough

Cons:

-Short. Without guides I beat the game in a bit under three hours, clicking and reading just about everything I could find. I hope the creator releases some DLC or similar in the future, I would really like to see some other paranormal tropes explored. This is the main flaw in the game imo.

- 3/6 of the cases are about ghosts or spirits, and one has no supernatrual 'entity' at all. This isn't a universal problem, but personally I wish more supernatrual mumbo jumbo was used

- You never really 'investigate' a scene. There's often a mystery, but you never piece together clues or figure it out as a player. This makes the game a little more casual which is fine, but it's someting to keep in mind if you're looking for a game that requires more deductive thinking. 

- There are some cutscenes in one of the trailer that aren't actually in the game. Again, this isn't an awful betrayal or anything, but it's something to keep in mind. 


Overall this is a really well made game in my opinion, I just wish there was more of it. It's listed at $13 at the moment, and I can see wanting to wait until a sale drops it to 50% off or so. If you're like me and happen to really like this setting or you really love point and click games, then feel free to pick it up. If you've only got $10 and want to make it last the rest of the month then this might not be the best pick.

34051231.review: A humorous lighthearted game that consists of 6 cases. The puzzles aren't hard to figure out and in each case there is at least 1 mini game that isn't hard either. A lot of refrences and silly humor.

34050836.review:

The dialogue (written not audible) is actually fun funny. Found myself laugh out loud a few times. I actually read the text rather than spam clicking my way through.

The Darkside Detective é um point-and-click sobre um detetive sobrenatural que tem seis casos para serem realizados, junto com seu parceiro policial. O jogo é extramente bem humorado e divertido até nas configurações!

34049757.review: An adventure game with lots of charm and character.  I really enjoyed it.  Great soundtrack too.

34046695.review:
Vi ricordate tutti i bei giochi di avventura punta-e-clicca degli anni novanta? Quelli con ottimo umorismo, storie avvincenti e pessimi enigmi?
Gli sviluppatori di The Darkside Detective se li ricordano, e hanno capito che si può fare un ottimo omaggio all'intero genere senza essere costretti a includere le parti peggiori.
Sei mini-episodi investigativi colmi di misteri occulti e umorismo surreale, che non vi faranno mai sbattere la testa sulla scrivania nel tentativo di capire quale combinazione ritardata di oggetti/personaggi/parti del paesaggio bisogna creare per andare avanti.

Forse un po' breve (sempre a causa della relativa semplicità), ma la qualità è alta ed è sicuro di strapparvi qualche risata, andando a stimolare la nostalgia senza però farvi ricordare le parti peggiori.
Consigliato.

34045941.review: Imagine Twin Peaks + X Files + Monty Python-esque writing as an adventure game, and you have Darkside Detective. The puzzles are almost always intuiative and the game doesn't outstay its welcome. Each "act" being its own case means it's easy to pick up and put down as time demands. I finished it in three sessions, with my husband watching along with me. If you like adventure games with fun writing, pixel art, and/or straight forward but interesting puzzles, check this game out.

34042130.review: This is a fantastic game with amazing humor. If you like funny point and click detective games, I highly suggest this one. It's not very difficult, taking me about 3 hours to beat, but it's still a pretty fun.

34035423.review:
I can really recommend this game if you like to spend a few hours (almost 4 hours for me to 100% the game with all achievements) with a relaxing point and click adventure/puzzle game. Lots of funny dialogues that made me chuckle. The puzzles aren't that hard and I cannot imagine anyone getting stuck. Some achievements do require some timing and sometimes excessive clicking, but that's only for those 100% achievers under us.

I think 11,49 euro's isn't too much to ask for 3-4 hours of entertainment. Looking forward to any additional mission DLC or sequel!

34035115.review:
양 차원을 넘나드는 미스테리 수사극.

어둠의 차원과 빛의 차원을 돌아다니며 기괴한 미제 사건들을 해결해나가는 이야기를 담은 픽셀 그래픽의 어드벤처 게임이다. 기본적으로는 등장인물들간의 대화와 특정한 공간을 돌아다니며 획득한 아이템을 활용해 사건을 해결해나가는 전형적인 포인트 앤 클릭 방식의 어드벤처 게임이다. 또한 픽셀 그래픽의 게임인데, 픽셀 한 조각이 꽤 큰지라 게임을 풀스크린으로 하면 비대한 픽셀 조각으로 인해 눈이 좀 따가울 여지가 있다.

총 6개의 챕터가 준비되있으며, 각 챕터간의 연관성은 그다지 없어보이는 옴니버스 식 구성을 보이고 있다. 각 챕터마다 이동할 수 있는 장소가 그리 많지 않으며, 챕터의 길이도 대체로 짧은 편이고 줄거리 역시 알기 쉽게 흘러간다. 영어 해석이 어느 정도 가능하고 어느 정도 눈치만 있으면 상당히 쾌적한 진행이 가능한 게임이다. 조금 짧다는게 불만일 순 있겠지만, 대신 게임하다 크게 막힐 걱정은 안 해도 된다.

줄거리 역시 꽤나 유쾌하게 흘러간다. 양 차원을 오고가며, 유령이나 그렘린, 좀비 따위의 괴물들을 상대하는 게임이지만, 전반적인 게임의 분위기가 그다지 어두운 편은 아니다. 어떤 기괴한 것들이 나와도(그나마 그 기괴한 것 조차 다소 코믹하게 느껴질 뿐이긴 하지만) 시종일관 특유의 유쾌함을 잃지 않는다. 특히나 탐정 프랜시스 맥퀸과 그와 동행하는 경관 둘리(진짜 이름이 둘리다. Dooley)의 만담이 상당한 재미를 선사한다. 간간히 제4의 벽을 인식하는 대사라던가 깨알같은 패러디들도 준비되있는 등, 나름 밝고 즐거운 분위기를 유지하려는 노력이 돋보인다.

썩 괜찮았던 어드벤처 게임. 이 작품이 잘 되면 후속작도 낼 생각인가본데, 무사히 후속작이 등장해줬으면 싶다.

34025198.review:
The overall game feels like a bite-sized adventure story, but it really delivers in that space.

The humour is of a kind of elbow-to-the-ribs nature (hats off to my favourite character John), and the characters have a silly-sweet appeal that make the ensemble cast really fun to interact with. The art and music also come together to make a cute-weird aesthetic that really heightens the characterisation.

TL;DR: You'll likely wrap up the story in a single evening, but if you like quips, jibes and loveable characters, you'll find real charm in the fine details of this wonderful, whimsical tale.

SIDE-RANT: Seeing the usual 'short game for the price' responses on here, I have to react: 10 bucks for a three hour game is really not so much, especially when it's not going to be selling millions of copies on the mainstream market. Games like this, Thomas Was Alone and Monument Valley get this outcry every freaking time, but you wouldn't act the same way over a DVD sale of 60 quid for the same 2 - 3 hour payoff, now would you? /endrant

34001791.review:
A great little sci fi point and click adventure game. The puzzles are very logical compared to classic adventure games, and the individual cases means there's no wandering around a massive map with 50 inventory items. Some people might find it a bit simple but I definitely consider that a plus, I'm too old and have more respect for my free time for a proper Sierra/LucasArts grind these days, but I enjoyed this little reminder of it. 

The best part though is definitely the writing. I loved the dialogue, all the cases were interesting, and it was very funny (as long as you don't mind a lot of geek culture/90s nostalgia references). 

Some people have said it's a bit short for the price, for me it was definitely worth it, 6hrs of entertainment for the price of a cinema ticket. Replayability is fairly limited although I am tempted to go back and look for the last few hidden achievements.

I also really appreciated the free curse removal, finally I can go out at night again!

33991237.review: Spooky game for spooks and spookettes, with great cameos and the realization that the most terrifying writer is Stephenie Meyer. 9 spooks out of 10, would spook again.

33991094.review:
[h1]Imagine if Monkey Island, Blackadder and the X-Files had a threesome…[/h1]

We play Detective Francis McQueen, a police detective who is into “spooky crap” (as Officer Patrick Dooley puts it), aka investigating crimes where there is an element of the supernatural – the Darkside – with his fairly useless and slightly corrupt sidekick. The dialogue is sharp, to the point and extremely witty throughout. Almost the entire game is written with humour. Sometimes silly, sometimes downright farcical and often clever. Peppered with smart linguistics and pop culture references, it was a real delight to read. It had me smirking in the very first interaction and that keeps up throughout and it reminded me in many ways of the Discworld game, which is a real treat since I’ve been a hardcore Terry Pratchett fan for two decades.

This is a point and click adventure game, so we must work our way through a series of interactions and logical puzzles to figure out how to progress and solve all six of the Detective’s outstanding cases. There were some moments of guesswork for me – but ultimately everything was entirely logical and made perfect sense, even if I didn’t always quite get it until I’d tried quite a lot of things. Through talking to folks, investigating items, combining things and a couple of simple puzzles, we progress through each spooky story. The gameplay is very minimalist and relatively fast; you don’t control or move your character, only scene changes and there is very little animation. This does mean you move through it at a pace and the bite-size episodic cases make it easy to play in short bursts but still feel very satisfied with what you’ve achieved.

The graphics are very much stylized block pixel 2D graphics, which won’t be for everyone. My husband, for example, hates this graphical style and would never consider playing it – aesthetics is definitely a strong personal preference. I like the graphics and felt they fit well with the overall atmosphere of the game, which is also heavily reinforced by the appropriately spooky soundtrack. The music is serious and really creates the setting for the scene changes – this works incredibly well with the humorous dialogue and gives the game a more cohesive feeling. You are at the end of the day, solving crime here!

The game is short; taking me just 4 hours to complete all six cases (and if you’ve played the demo, that will be five). I didn’t find all the hidden achievements there so there is perhaps an extra challenge for hardcore completionists, but on the whole there is very little replay value so some may question the value. On the settings side this game is bare bones; there no resolution options, no window size options and the game is played in full screen mode which might frustrate those who are used to running multiple monitors and alt-tabbing. The only settings are for sound.

I enjoyed every minute of this game though and would highly recommend it to fans of the genre, or newcomers who like amusing dialogue. A thoroughly engaging and entertaining game from start to finish. Need more!

[h1]If you’re not sure if this is for you, check out the demo which is the first case. Like right now. Go, go, go![/h1]

33981532.review:
I love the art, the theme, the story, the puzzles, and the humor. This is a very well done game and, though it is somewhat short, it's well worth the price of a movie ticket (at least where I live).

Basically, it's a point and click adventure game with a bit of an X-Files flair that's not too terribly difficult, but just right, in my opinion, for a nice casual gaming session. I recommend you click on everything and everyone not because of puzzles, but because some of the dialog is hilarious.

33921157.review:
TL;DR - a good point-and-click game in the style of many classic adventure games, with excellent writing and humour, but definitely on the short side. I beat all six cases in three hours, so take from it what you will.

The Darkside Detective is a game about a detective investigating supernatural phenomena - here, it's called the Darkside. It's got its share of conspiracy theories, kooky monsters, ghosts floating everywhere, and the occasional hellish ritual. The game is divvied up into 6 different cases, and each plays like a bite-sized point-and-click adventure. Most of the puzzles are logical, with some hilarious outcomes (a certain junction box comes to mind), but you do have to look closely to progress through the game at times.

There isn't really an overarching storyline, save for a few common themes and characters, but it's a good romp. The characters are hilarious - you have the rivalry between McQueen and McKing (hah!), Dooley's bizarre interests and his adorable (if not slightly creepy) Bloodwolf camp. You even have a fusty old librarian who has a soft spot for awful chick lit.

The music is also fantastic, done by Ben Prunty of FTL fame. Pity it's not purchasable via Steam (only by Bandcamp), because I'd happily fork out more money to pick up the soundtrack! The graphics are nothing to write home about, but the pixellated style adds its own charm.

The only real downside is how short the entire game is. I finished all six mysteries in one sitting, and that was with me reading and investigating all the nooks and crannies I could get my hands on. Granted, I may have missed some parts, but I investigated most of the areas. I got this discounted, having purchased it at USD$10, so whether you think it's worth it is entirely down to how much you enjoy point-and-clicks. I hope maybe with enough people playing, the developers will consider adding longer episodes, such as the one we got in Episode 6.

33918195.review:
(No spoilers, just mentions of things in the game that will in no way retract from your enjoymet of it)

I've been following the development of this game for roughly 2 years (maybe less) and I have to say, it's exactly what I expected. Francis Mcqueen is an overworked and underpaid Detetive who's tasked with finding and stopping supernatural events, with Dooley, a well meaning consipiracy-theorist. Together the pair go through six cases that range from things mysteriously breaking in the office to a full scale zombie attack. The episodes are not really connected together and there's not really one overarching threat as I'd hoped, but It does fit in with the theme of the game overall (See: Monster of the week). My general rule of thumb is 1hr of fun playtime =$1, but with games like this, that doesn't exactly work. It's more about the quality of the the game when it is as short as this on is but It definitely checks out in the quality department. 

Dialogue- It's solid, nothing really exceptional. Nothing that really made me laugh until I was crying but in a strange way that doesn't bother me at all.

Art- One of the two best things about this game. I like pixel art when done well and this was definitely done well.

Music- The other great thing about this game, each track compliments the art. It really represents the tone of the game. My two favorite soundtracks are the one that plays after the resolution of each case and when you're using BETI. I'm almost tempted to buy the soundtrack.

Difficulty- Not much of a challenge at all, so if you're looking for a difficult point and click game look elsewhere.

Price- I bought it during the sale when it was a bit under $10 but $12 doesn't seem so bad. If you're looking for something that will give you a lot of time you might want to wait for a sale, but if you're a fan of light-hearted point and click games, I'd give it ago. With Steam's refund policy you could play it for an hour and see if it's your kind of game.

Overall- I'd like to see more content for this game, hopefully in the form of DLC (hopefully free but I understand the devs need to eat) to really flesh out the game. I'd definitely love to see more of Francis Mcqueen's adventures. A solid game for sure, that's worth the purchase if you're into point and click games.

The Darkside Detective est un point'n click sans la moindre difficulté insurmontable qui n'a d'autre ambition que de vous faire passer un bon moment. 6 enquêtes à résoudre, chacune entre 15 et 30 minutes grand maximum.

C'est avant tout un jeu d'ambiance et d'écriture : vous accompagnerez le Detective McQueen et son acolyte Dooley sur les lieux des crimes les plus mystérieux de Twin Lake. En tant que détective, personne ne vous prendra bien évidemment au sérieux et Dooley tâchera de vérifier ses théories complotistes les plus folles à chaque enquète. Aucun des personnages que vous croiserez n'aura la personnalité attendue et l'on passe plus de temps à rire des jeux de mots (en anglais) et de l'humour qu'à se creuser la tête pour trouver la solution d'un puzzle.

Je ne peux que vous encourager à tenter l'aventure si vous cherchez un "tout" petit point'n click sympa à faire d'autant que les développeurs ne cachent pas leur envie d'une suite plus ambitieuse si celui-ci fait son petit bout de chemin.

Et de vous à moi, je ne demande que ça.

33910118.review:
[h1]Nepřemýšlejte a kupujte! Parádní mix lehké adventury, detektivky a komedie za příznivou cenu![/h1]
Hra, ve které hrajete za detektiva, řešíte různé nadpřirozené případy a vůbec se nebere vážně? Je jasné, že mi The Darkside Detective neuniklo a já si to po chvíli přemýšlení koupil. Vyplatilo se?

Tento titul je taková jednoduchá adventura, kdy chodíte po lokacích, sbíráte předměty, používáte je ve vhodný okamžik, případně vyřešíte jedno z pár triviálních puzzlů. I přes to, jak je hratelnost jednoduchá, jsem si tuhle hru užil. Nejsou tu žádné dlouhé záseky, žádné neintuitivní kombinování předmětů, žádná frustrace. Hrou projdete jako nůž máslem a ještě se u toho dost nasmějete.

Právě humor je tu naprosto boží. Tolik popkulturních narážek jsem snad v žádné jiné hře neviděl. Téměř každá věta dialogu nebo popisu je vtipná nebo odkazuje na věc z reálného života. Stačí si přečíst již názvy případů a bude vám jasné, že se tohle nebere vůbec vážně. Potíží tak může být to, že nepochytíte, z čeho si tvůrci vlastně dělají srandu. Naštěstí i každý z případů je sám o sobě vtipný. Zápletka je pokaždé jiná, dostáváme se na jiná místa a kupodivu se jemně řeší i vztahy těch pár postav. Z těch bych chtěl vyzdvihnout především obě dvě hlavní - detektiva McQueena a jeho věrného parťáka, hloupého policistu Dooleyho. Ten sype z rukávu jednu hlášku za druhou a nad jeho stupiditou budete neustále jen kroutit hlavou. Tato dvojice mi za ty čtyři hodiny až neuvěřitelně přirostla k srdci a pevně doufám, že se bude dařit a dočkáme se pokračování.

Překvapilo mě také, že případy na sebe navazují, takže postavy z jednoho se můžou objevit v tom dalším. Sice tu nemají moc velkou roli, ale je to příjemná věc. Ve hře The Darkside Detective na nás čeká šest různých případů, jejichž délka i náročnost je postupně větší a větší. I přes tento fakt mi dohrání hry zabralo jen 4 hodiny, což zamrzí. Grafická stylizace je taková kostičkovaná, ale ona hra vypadá opravdu dost dobře. Pak tu máte parádní hudbu, která dodává na atmosféře a je perfektní. Na bugy jsem vůbec nenarazil a hra se ukládá automaticky.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ humor a HROMADA popkulturních narážek
+ sympatické hlavní postavy
+ šest různých případů se zajímavým pozadím
+ hra je jednoduchá a díky tomu nehrozí žádné záseky
+ parádní audiovizuální styl

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- délka hry

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 10/10[/b]

Pokud jde o komediální hry, tahle se bezesporu řadí mezi špičku. Humoru tu je hromada a jsem opravdu mile překvapen, že se z tohohle stal takový menší klenot na poli indie her. Doufám, že prodeje budou obrovské, takže se dočkáme i dalšího dílu. Rozhodně kupujte!

33904245.review:
The Darkside Detective is a neat little semi-adventure game. given the game's scale and probably budget, it produced a result that blew my expectation. the gameplay itself is simple, it consist of dragging objects to objects, people or background. the puzzles itself are all relatively simple and easy to figure out. all things considered, you can barely call this a proper adventure game, but that's where game game's lacking ended. 

the story and dialogue itself is fun, we play as detective McQueen with his partner the adorably foolish dooley and they solve occult cases together, from kidnapped child to a zombie outbreak. all dialogue and interaction are comedically done well. every single jokes, dooley's ignorant and plain stupid comments and his conspiracy paranoia are hilarious, along with detective's McQueen's wisecracks and jabs. these two characters works so well together. they got the right chemistry and interaction. the duo are the highlight of the game. other characters exist, but without all the development the duo got, but they still serve for a fun extras of the story, some reccuring characters are still memorable and fun to talk to. 

overall, if you ask is this a good adventure game? probably no. the inventory are sparse, and the interaction you got can be limited, there are no real challenge to the game itself and definitely don't really make you wrack your brain over a puzzle.

but if you ask is this a fun game? YES! the puzzles served its purpose not as a challenge, but as a context and delivery device for the hilarious joke. i think the game is really funny and that's where the greatness lies. every single lines are funny and well written, they don't take itself too seriously without being too intrusive and forced. 

despite the absurdness, everything fell in place, no jokes ever feel forced, and they feel kinda relatively natural for such a wacky adventure. 

the music is GOOD. Ben Prunty did a great job composing moody-spooky tunes-yet-not-too-gloomy that fits the overall theme of the game. the game itself probably worth it if you like moody ambient music. 

overall, my impression of this game is "go ahead if you want a quality laughs and fun, but don't if you expect challenging puzzles and complex interactions"

33893363.review:
A little on the short side but if you can over look that you've got yourself a pretty fun lil adventure to explore. 

I personally love the whole rivalry between Mcqueen and McKing when you enter the Police Farce chapter. Your sidekick Dooley's love of rotten food and discarded adult magazines certainly made him one of my favorite characters as well throughout the game. Not to mention some Discworld references among many other nods to adventure games thrown in for good measure. 

Writing and humor can always be subjective. Yes some of the jokes can fall a bit flat. On the other hand there are quite a few good ones tucked about the game delivered in a pretty sly tongue-in-cheek manner. 

The music is great and the game looks wonderful for the style they're going for. Anyone who has already played something like the Last Door will have a bit of an idea what to expect out of the interaction system. 

It could have been a little nicer, had you actually been able to free roam and control your characters. Rather than only being able to interact with objects while your characters usually remain static. Perhaps some people might not mind this. Since it does save alot of time from having to walk back an forth through screens, by being able to instantly move into the next area with a single click. 

Much more of a comedic adventure game than a dark sinster classic detective style game like you may imagine. It's less Gabriel Knight or Police Force and much closer to more light hearted games like Discworld or maybe even the Tex Murphy series in some ways. Of course it has alot of it's own original feel to it as well. 

 For a first time play through might be looking at around 3-5 hours of play time depending on how much of an achievement hunter you are. In fact once you know all the solutions you can probably speed through the game in less than 30 minutes. Not a whole lot of reply value right off the bat, unless you missed some achievements. Given some time however I'm pretty sure it's a game you'd want to come back to just to relive again. 

I'd recommend picking this up if you're looking for a fairly short but rewarding adventure game experience. Hopefully we'll get to see longer episodes released in the future.

I haven't played a point-and-click adventure in some time, but this one has made me want to get back into the genre. It was a lot of fun with some pretty great jokes strewn about. It had me snorting to myself occasionally with its dry humor. If you like older titles like Space Quest, you'll probably like this. It also has quite a few references to other areas of nerd culture. Some extra notes about the game for those interested:

-There are 6 parts to the game in total. I believe the first one is available via the demo.

33874876.review:
PROS: -Great sound design and soundtrack
-Good, humorous writing
-Atmospheric
-Fairly priced

CONS: -Rather short
-Puzzles are very simple
-Lackluster animation

I found out about this game from playing the flash demo version on Kongregate and it immediately hooked me. At first I thought it was going to be a lovecraftian themed point and click, but instead got a sort of parody on the occult detective genre. However, it turned out not to be disappointing and fun in its own way. McQueen and Dooley are interesting, though a bit cliche in character. Their banter is written fair enough though that it was entertaining. Sadly it was quickly over since it only took me less than two hours to complete the entire thing including the demo level. Despite this, I feel like they built up the atmosphere very well for Twin Lakes. Recurring characters help make the city feel lived in and makes me want to see more adventures. Some might be turned off by the very short play time, but for me I look at it as an interactive movie. The last case file is especially dramatic and it was a good climax. The puzzles really weren't too difficult to hamper progress, but just enough that you could still call it a game. On the positive side they are all unique, so you don't feel like you're repeating segments. For the price I think it's alright and it's nice to support smaller devs and artists.

Here's hoping they add more to the game and keep the story going.

33874384.review:
As a reviewer, I could play this game one month ago, but I ended up forgetting to write this review sooner. So, this game is like a RPG character, while the beginning is bad to mediocre, the ending is almost as good as classical Lucas Arts games and some Phoenix Wright titles (the not so great ones), all of this is because the evolution of the developer team during the development process. 
The investigation works well all the time, some solutions are tough and demand investment from the player, the mystery related to the Darkside is very good because it's something the player has to discover. The screenplay lacks substance, though, it could have more details and development. If compared to great classicals like Ghost Trick and Day of the Tentacle, it pales. 
Most jokes don't work, they are inserted in wrong situations and are mostly old jokes. The only ones that made me laugh are in the credits, and this is not a good thing. 
The game has lots of references, maybe more than BvS. Some work well when they help the story in the minimum, however, some get too important, more than they should be, original concepts would work better.
The game also has its cliches: The grandfather's clock to create atmosphere, because every spooky atmosphere needs a grandfather's clock to be spooky. There's also the subliminal message of the 666, it made me remember of Final Fantasy VIII and that it wasn't really new by that time either. 
In the end, the game gets much better, all bad things are left aside to focus on the investigation, there's even a specific moment where there's a split in the gameplay. The urgency feeling gets bigger as the game knows how to reach its climax and the writting gets a little better. I really hope for this game's success and that the developer makes a new game, but they have to work on something based in the quality of the ending of this one, not the premise.

Score: Beginning 3,5.
Ending 7,5.
Total score: 5,5. 
I can't recommend it yet, but I really hope for a good future to the developers.

33846122.review:
Awesome point&click supernatural detective game. The game is broken down into several short case files where you find yourself investigating a crime and/or strange occurrence and then solving it. So far the case files have been fairly independent plots, only related by the same overall theme and detective duo. I like the "short story" style of this game since it fits my attention better. If you enjoyed playing point&click games like Blackwell and Kathy Rain then you'll definitely want this one.

The graphics/artwork are awesome - considering it's fairly blocky pixel art, it does an excellent job at conveying a lot of detail with its own unique style. The sound and music are also excellent with everything feeling very cohesive. The dialog is well written and amusing with likable characters that draw you into the story. I'm always surprised at how many point&click games seem to have trouble perfecting the simple, time-tested controls for this type of game - and thankfully in this case, these developers are some of the few who knew what they were doing. In terms of the user interface, everything just worked exactly as I hoped/expected it should work. 

I hope this team puts out some more games in the future (or even some DLCs with more cases would be awesome since I'm sure i'll want more).

Update: Finished it... soooo good.

This game was what the doctor ordered. Gaming needs more comedy. There have been plenty of stabs at replicating the humor of the earlier point and click adventure games and few have succeeded (noting this with Thimbleweed Park makes 2017 a truly special year for this genre). During the demo as with the game I actually laughed.. Out loud. All those lol's I've sent have been rubbish, this was packed full of actual belly wrenching laughter. The story is bulletproof, the characters develop nicely but you already feel like you know them or someone similar. The cases have been nothing short of good old fashion fun- another rare achievement, enjoyable puzzles! 
We know the writing is mint, reviews are praising it as they should. But don't forget Paul Conway who delivered astonishing, captivating, mood filled pixel art, that I think is up there with the best in world right now such as Octavi, Ben and so many more. The lighting completes the paranormal feel, the characters show incredible character and emotion just through their body postures that the unique and frankly really cool blank faces just add to the comedy and feel. 
You cannot not enjoy this game. Buy it and hope with me this is far from the last that we see if this talented Dev team and of course McQueen and friends!

Mucho humor, fantasmas y píxeles por doquier. El detective McQueen tendrá que resolver los casos más insólitos en esta increíble aventura gráfica que los atrapará desde el primer minuto.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dT-R8FP_Lvk
Análisis completo publicado [url=https://www.simpatiaporlacritica.com/single-post/2017/07/27/The-Darkside-Detective]aquí[/url]
 
The Darkside Detective es una aventura gráfica clásica, con gráficos pixel art y un gran sentido estético. La creación de Spooky Doorway nos lleva directo a las viejas aventuras de antaño, con excelentes diálogos, una trama de casos entretenidos y muchísimos chistes, con vastas referencias a otros videojuegos y cultura pop en general.
 
Controlamos al detective Francis McQueen, el único integrante de la división policial para casos sobrenaturales. Nuestro héroe es asistido por el oficial Dooley, un policía completamente delirante y amigo de McQueen desde la niñez, que no tiene mucha idea sobre lo que investigamos pero intenta ser útil de alguna manera. Los hechos se irán complejizando para este dúo inusual, a medida que intentan resolver los casos sobrenaturales más bizarros.

El entorno gráfico es completamente pixelado, con la estética low-fi tan en boga estos úlltimos años. Por supuesto que no todo el público comprenderá esta decisión y será una barrera (sobre todo para menores de 25 años) pero rápidamente se compensará con el impacto del guión y el humor casi sin parar. En cuanto a los puzzles, la dificultad es de baja a media, sin demasiados sobresaltos, aunque como es predecible, a medida que avanzamos en los casos, los puzzles se irán complejizando.
 
Merece un párrafo aparte la banda sonora original compuesta por Ben Prunty, una verdadera joya que probablemente vea la luz como un DLC aparte. Como mencionamos antes, la "baja calidad" de los gráficos es compensada con exquisiteces como la música y los diálogos. El combo funciona de maravillas y llega un momento de disfrute tal que ya no importa si estamos mirando a dos cuadrados que hablan entre sí, todo pareciera estar en resolución 4K.
 
Por supuesto que recomendamos este título, y la única preocupación es que este juego se convierta en franquicia y veamos más entregas. Un trabajo independiente realizado con tal nivel de precisión merece nuestros respetos, y el hecho de no encontrar puntos negativos ya es motivo suficiente para probarlo.

39338325.review:
The darkside detective is a fun comedy, paranormal investigation point and click game. That pays homage to old horror writers and paranormal TV shows like H.P Lovecraft and the X-Files respectively. There are six cases that each wrap pop culture references and comedic bits, light-heartedly taking the piss out of other point and click adventures and paranormal culture. With an additional seventh christmas case. Each case is separate to one another meaning that you can jump in and out of the game easily without losing the plot or forgetting where you were; like in most open ended games, such as Skyrim. Making it perfect for those who don’t have a vast amount of time on their hands.
 
The cases themselves aren’t naturally long. However can be drawn out depending on how fast you solve the puzzles in each case that are ingenuitive and always clear. What you would assume is the answer to solve the problem in reality is often the answer in the game. Each case excluding the seventh; which re-uses elements from past cases (breaking the fourth wall to make a joke to justify it), is completely different and gripping in different ways.

You play as Paranormal Detective Francis McQueen, a detective at TLPD. Much like Moulder in the X-Files his department is seen as a joke by other in the police department and relegated to a more dilapidated part of the station. With a dim witted sidekick called officer Dooley, who’s there to act as comedic relief and in some cases a major character to the plot. There are also various side characters that pepper the games landscape; such as the rival detective McKing and Chief Scully (another nod to the X-Files). 
Overall the game is fun and accessible to all types of people. It’s got good writing and well designed puzzles. However it doesn’t have a great deal of repeatability, due to the cases being rather short, so unless you have a bad memory when repeating a case you’ll most likely remember what to do. The game cost about ten pounds, which is a little steep for the game considering it’s only about 5 hours long. There is a [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/368390/The_Darkside_Detective/]demo available[/url] which showcases the first case. So if this review hasn’t swayed you in one way or another you can check that out for free.

39061601.review:
Heyo folks, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for The Darkside Detective by Spooky Doorway.

The Darkside Chronicles is a humorous mini-adventure game. It follows a detective named Francis McQueen and his partner Dooley. They are sent on a series of 6 cases, each dealing with the paranormal. Each case has a unique story to tell and they take you to many different places around Twin Lakes.

My favorite case out of all of them is easily the second one. This one takes place inside a haunted library. All of the ghosts are of famous authors including H.P. Lovecraft, Edgar Allen Poe, Douglas Adams, Mary Shelley and Terry Pratchett to name a couple. Most of them have an objective tied to them as well. H.P. Lovecraft and Edgar Allen Poe are fighting over who writes the best horror and you must find them a book that’s scarier than both of theirs.

The game’s best feature is it’s excellent sense of humor. It relies on sarcasm, puns and references and it’s nonstop throughout the game. It had me cracking up numerous times as I played through it. Even the credits are hilarious.

Francis’ partner, Dooley, is easily one of my favorite characters in the game. His jokes are pretty amazing and his dialogue is incredibly witty and well-written.

The game lives up to it’s mini-adventure title though and can be completed in 6 hours. It’s well worth experiencing, just for the jokes, though.

Overall, The Darkside Detective has been the funniest game that I’ve had the pleasure of experiencing in a while. The jokes were excellent and my motto is, if a game can make me laugh consistently, then it’s a winner in my book. The Darkside Detective does just that, and it was a great journey. I hope a sequel is able to be made in the end though because it definitely deserves one.

If you're interested in checking out the full review, or would simply like to see my final score, you can find my review here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/adventure/darkside-detective-review

Thanks for taking the time to read the review folks, and happy gaming!

40965937.review:
I grew up on adventure games. Heck, look at my avatar! They were well written, and a perfect way to spend my near-infinite free time exploring.

Today, I'm an adult, and free time is at a sever premium. I have no patience for classic adventure games and their ilk, what with all the aimless wandering, opaque puzzles, and minimal payoff.

This is an exception. It's very much in the school of old adventure games: you combine inventory items and explore to solve puzzles. You also do some actual, literal logic puzzles, which I wasn't hugely into, but that's what walkthroughs are for. But the structure of the game, where you have discrete cases that take place in limited environs, makes all the difference. It's not too bad to find what you need, and there's a lot of excellent text and dialogue to read. The game doesn't waste any time transitioning from screen to screen, and the puzzles often make sense, in a fashion.

What we're left with is a delightful fusion of the tone, aesthetics, and gameplay of classic adventure games and the most important innovation of modern gaming: respecting the player's time. If you have any nostalgia for the genre, or you want to try it out, this is one of the best starting points I can think of.

Troszkę mi szkoda, że daję tej grze kciuka w dół, bo jest naprawdę sympatyczna... ale niestety mam wrażenie, że twórcy nie przemyśleli sobie do końca targetu, w który celują i wyszedł produkt ani dla dorosłych, ani dla dzieci.

W "The Darkside Dedective" kierujemy krokami pary stróży prawa z wydziału do spraw paranormalnych - detektywa Francisa McQueena i jego przygłupiego partnera Dooly'ego. Już samo takie zestawienie gwarantuje salwy śmiechu i faktycznie humor to najmocniejsza strona tej produkcji. Co rusz natrafiamy na easter eggi, aluzje do popkultury minionego wieku czy po prostu naprawdę śmieszne żarty. Trzeba jednak zaznaczyć, że o ile Dooley faktycznie to postać pełna osobowości, o tyle McQueen już jej nie ma - jest nudny jak flaki z olejem.

Główny minus gry to jej poziom trudności, który określiłabym jako "moja pierwsza przygodówka". Lokacje nie są duże (z wyjątkiem ostatniej sprawy), przedmiotów niewiele, także dopasowanie wszystkiego do siebie nie powinno sprawić większych trudności nikomu, a już zwłaszcza przygodówkowym wyjadaczom. Byłaby to zatem idealna gra dla dzieci... problem w tym, że humor jest tu momentami nieco przyciężki, a maluchy mogą mieć problem ze zrozumieniem wszystkiego, pomijając nawet barierę językową.

Muzyka bardzo przypadła mi do gustu - inspiracja "Stranger Things" jest ewidentna - ale niestety z pikseli można wyciągnąć dużo więcej. Wiem, że twórcy inspirowali się starymi przygodówkami, ale mogli chociaż zadbać o większą rozdzielczość.

"The Darkside Detective" to miła i sympatyczna gra, ale zdecydowanie ani nie dla mnie, ani dla osób, które szukają wyzwania. Jeśli jednak ktoś chce spędzić wieczór po pracy czy szkole i nie stresować się kolejną zagadką nie do rozwiązania, to produkcja ta będzie idealna.

This was a very witty and quirky game. The banter between Dooley and McQueen (the two main characters in the game) made the game worth paying for. It just didn't do it for me with the game play. I got through quite a few of the cases in the game, and I may go back to finish them out, but I think I'm on the fourth case, and I was ready to put it away. 

Some of the solving of the puzzles just required you to run back and forth, back and forth. Unfortunately for me in the midst of all of that hiking, there were too things I would click, but it wouldn't register. And in a game that is nothing but pixelated point and click, that makes for a very frustrating situation when you are off, searching for what the answer is, only to find out later that you HAD the right answer before, but it didn't register the "click."

The story lines were good, and the humor in it was top notch, so I didn't hate my time that I played the game. It just wasn't for me. The pixel animation was very... pixelated. :)  Sometimes I had a hard time distinguishing what things were, and I grew up in the time of Atari. 

But I would say try it if you can find it on sale, and if you like point and click games. I thought it would be a bit more on the horror side, but think of it more as a paranormal adventure-style game. Also, the cases in the games are fairly short, so you can get through an entire one without having to save, and for someone with kids, that is a bonus. :)  You get an entire story in about 30 minutes to an hour.

I loved this game. It's a point and click adventure game (think in the style of Day of the Tentacle). What sets it aside from a lot of this genre is that it's divided up into "cases," each one lasting somewhere between 30 minutes to an hour. I liked that format; the inventory I amassed was smaller, so I never got stuck, and having the story split into digestable chunks meant that I didn't run into that problem I sometimes do with longer adventure games, where I play for a while, get busy with work or school or whatever, and then come back a week later barely remembering what was going on. I wish more video games would use this short story format.

The game looks great, with a throwback blocky pixel style. The music's good, and game made me laugh a lot. In fact, I wound up stretching the game out because I clicked on everything, just appreciating the constant jokes that prompted.

40445045.review:
A funny point and click adventure that has you join Detective McQueen as he delves into supernatural mysteries that plague his jurisdiction of 'Twin Lakes City'. 'Darkside Detective' is divided into 7 mini-levels, or 'cases' and this format means no location or storyline overstays it's welcome. Before you know it you'll be rewarded for closing a case by being whisked away to a new area with a whole new gang of misfits and weirdos to interrogate.  The puzzles in each case are simple enough to ensure it's unlikely that you will ever become completely stuck and frustatrated. I wouldn't say it's too easy though, I'd say the difficulty is just about right because really the puzzles aren't the main attraction here, knowing the game isn't going to be super-challenging you can relax and take in the plot and enjoy the real highlight, the witty dialogue on offer, of which there is plenty. The best of this dialogue is served up by the detective himself and his rather intellectually challenged companion Officer Dooley. Where McQueen is keen and sharp as a tack Dooley is a bit lazy and sharp as a marshmallow, this combination is where the real joy of the game lies and the pair do make for a fine comedy double-act.

If you enjoyed the humour of point and click classics such as Monkey island or Day of the Tentacle, games that have definitely inspired the team behind 'Darkside' I would thoroughly recommend this one to you.

This is a really fun point-and-click.

I feel like it strikes the right balance of puzzle difficulty where just about the point where you start considering trial-and-error, you realize what the answer is. Or at least that happened to me on the first case, and it felt great.

Every other time I got stuck, I just wasn't looking around as carefully as I should have, which is reasonable. You gotta look around and interact with everything you see, as much as possible...

Which is also how the game hits you with its best jokes-  Entirely missable interactions that just make you laugh for being the unexpected. It's a clever game that gives you a sidekick who follows you around most screens, and makes his dialogue, none of which is particularly helpful with the puzzle solving, funny enough that I'm actively trying to remember to talk to him constantly, or fills a library with saterical book names and gets me to actually try to read all of them.

I'm having a blast with it, and I don't even normally play point-and-clicks. If you're not sold, there's a free demo that's just the first case, and it seems the save transfers, since I didn't have to replay it.
